intro: Marcellia leptacantha, commonly known as the slender-leaf marcellia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with five petals and a distinctive central column. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments.
